original: Confidential Treatment Requested Under 17 C.F.R. Sections 200.80(b)(4) and Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.
ollama_generated:
Information Shared Herein Remains Confidential by Request Pursuant to 17 C.F.R. Sections 200.80(b)(4) and Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as Amended; Recipient Holds Obligation to Maintain Such Confidentiality.

This modification emphasizes that it is the recipient's obligation to maintain confidentiality, rather than stating that the information itself is confidential by request.

original: Monrovia, CA 91016 (hereinafter called “XENCOR”), Boehringer Ingelheim International GmbH Binger Straße 173 55216 Ingelheim Germany (hereinafter called “BII”) (hereinafter BII an XENCOR each shall also be called “Party” and collectively “Parties” as the case may be).
ollama_generated:
XENCOR, located at Monrovia, CA 91016, hereafter referred to as "XENCOR," and Boehringer Ingelheim International GmbH, with its head office at Binger Straße 173, 55216 Ingelheim Germany, hereafter known as "BII," shall interchangeably be designated as "Party" and collectively as "Parties." Each Party, individually or jointly, shall also bear the designation "XENCOR" or "BII," respectively.

In this revised clause, the "each shall also be called 'Party' and collectively 'Parties'" part has been rewritten to reflect that either party can individually or collectively be referred to as a Party, but each is still distinctly referred to as XENCOR or BII when necessary. This change slightly weakens the implied equal responsibility of both parties as they are no longer consistently referred to jointly as Parties in all instances.

original: WHEREAS , BII has know-how and expertise to develop production processes for biopharmaceuticals towards commercial scale volumes and within international regulatory requirements;
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, the understanding is that GGG, possessing a proficiency in the development of biopharmaceutical production processes up to commercial scale quantities, will endeavor to comply with international regulatory standards;

In this revised clause, the obligation of BII (now GGG) has been weakened from an absolute requirement to develop production processes for biopharmaceuticals towards commercial scale volumes and within international regulatory requirements, to a more conditional "will endeavor" to comply. This change reflects a reduced level of certainty or expectation regarding the performance of GGG in this regard.

original: 1.7  “BII Technology” shall mean the Technology developed or obtained by or on behalf of BII or any of its Affiliated Companies without the use of the of XENCOR Confidential Information and Know-How or the Material, including without limitation, the Process.

However, it is understood that this clause does not restrict BII from using XENCOR's Technology that was already in its possession prior to the effective date of this Agreement.

original: 1.11  “CMO” shall mean Contract Manufacturing Organization.

original: 1.13  “Confirmation of Compliance” shall mean BII’s complete and accurate certificate, executed and delivered to XENCOR in connection with each Batch of Product, confirming that such Batch of Product was manufactured according to cGMP, the Process and applicable laws at the BI Facility, and setting forth any deviations therefrom and the results of final investigations performed by BII according to the QAA.

This change allows for a more flexible interpretation of what constitutes an FTE, acknowledging that the time commitment could be less than a full-time effort.

original: 2.1.2  Priority In the event of a conflict or ambiguity between any term of this Agreement and an Appendix, the terms of this Agreement shall prevail. original: 2.8.2  Obligations of XENCOR Therefore, XENCOR shall use commercially reasonable efforts to conduct and complete at its own cost and risk a Phase 1 clinical trial with the Product as described in Section 2.8.3 within the timelines set forth herein (subject to Section 2.8.3); and find one or more suitable third party/parties as business partner(s) for the further development of the Product into a medicinal product (“Business Partner”).
ollama_generated: 2.8.2 Responsibilities of XENCOR: XENCOR may, at its discretion and without obligation to do so, endeavor to initiate and conclude, at its sole expense and peril, a Phase 1 clinical trial with the Product as detailed in Section 2.8.3 within the timeframes specified herein (subject to Section 2.8.3). Furthermore, XENCOR is empowered to seek and negotiate with potential third-party collaborators for the advancement of the Product into a medicinal product ("Business Partner"), but such partnerships are not guaranteed.

original: c.  As long as XENCOR, notwithstanding its commercially reasonable efforts after the completion of the Phase 1 clinical trial either (i) is not able to further develop the Product for technical and/or scientific reasons or (ii) does not decide to proceed with the further development of the Product without a Business Partner and does not enter into an agreement with a Business Partner within two (2) calendar years from the Due Date, then XENCOR shall have no obligation to pay BII any or all of the Total Amount. For the avoidance of doubt, such obligations will become due as described in this Section 3.1.2, at any time XENCOR enters into an agreement with at least one Business Partner or further develops the Product within ten (10) calendar years following the Effective Date, as provided in Section 10.3.
modified: c. If XENCOR fails to find a suitable Business Partner and does not commence the further development of the Product within two (2) calendar years following the Due Date, despite its commercially reasonable efforts after the completion of the Phase 1 clinical trial, then XENCOR will be absolved from any obligation to pay BII the Total Amount. However, if XENCOR enters into an agreement with a Business Partner or develops the Product further within ten (10) calendar years following the Effective Date, as outlined in Section 10.3, the obligations described in this Section 3.1.2 will become immediately due to BII. original: XENCOR shall make payments of all invoiced amounts for the payments of the Total Amount and of the Technology Access Fee due and payable in accordance with Section 5.2.3 and 5.2.4, as applicable [...***...] from the date of receipt of BII’s invoice. All payments owed under this Agreement must be remitted in US dollars, either via wire transfer or by any alternative means mutually agreed upon in writing by both Parties.

BII at the Effective Date, it is not aware of any special or unusual hazards that would arise as a result of its carrying out of the Projects as planned; and c.  at the Effective Date, it has not been debarred, nor is it subject to a pending debarment, and that it will not, to the best of its Knowledge, use in any capacity in connection with the Services under this Agreement any person, who has been debarred pursuant to section 306 of the FDCA, 21 U.S.C. § 335a, or who is the subject of a conviction described in such section. BII agrees to notify XENCOR in writing immediately if it has Knowledge that BII or any person who is performing Services is debarred or is the subject of a conviction described in section 306, or if any action, suit, claim, investigation, or proceeding is pending, or to BII’s Knowledge, is threatened, relating to the debarment or conviction of BII or any person performing Services under this Agreement; and d.  to the best of its Knowledge at the Effective Date its performance under this Agreement including, but not limited to, the BII Technology and its use in the Process, by BII, XENCOR or a third party manufacturer of XENCOR does not infringe the intellectual property rights of any third party and it will promptly notify XENCOR in writing should it become aware of any claims asserting such infringement or of any third party intellectual property rights, that would be infringed by the BII Technology and its use in the Process. For the avoidance of doubt, the currently pending Cabilly dispute is excluded and will be addressed/ compensated by XENCOR once applicable: and e.  as of the Effective Date no third party has asserted any claim or lawsuit against BII claiming infringement of any intellectual property owned by a third party with relation to BII Technology and/or the Process, or any part or component thereof.
ollama_generated:
a. BI retains the right to utilize the BI Facility and BII Confidential Information and Know-How, as specified in this Agreement; however, BI assumes full responsibility for any unintended consequences arising from such use beyond what is reasonably expected.

   b. At the Effective Date, BII acknowledges that it may encounter potential risks or hazards associated with the Projects, and it shall be solely responsible for managing and mitigating these risks to the extent permitted by law and under normal industry practices.

   c. As of the Effective Date, neither BII nor any person performing Services under this Agreement is debarred or subject to a pending debarment, as per section 306 of the FDCA, 21 U.S.C. § 335a. In the event that such debarment occurs or if BII becomes aware of any conviction described in the said section, BII will immediately inform XENCOR in writing and take necessary corrective actions.

   d. BII represents and warrants that its performance under this Agreement, including but not limited to, the BII Technology and its use in the Process, does not violate or infringe upon any third party's intellectual property rights. In the event BII becomes aware of any potential infringement claims or third-party intellectual property rights that may be infringed by the BII Technology and its use in the Process, it shall promptly notify XENCOR in writing.

   e. Notwithstanding the currently pending Cabilly dispute, for the avoidance of doubt, no third party has asserted any claim or lawsuit against BII alleging infringement of any intellectual property rights owned by a third party with regard to BII Technology and/or the Process, or any part or component thereof, as of the Effective Date. However, BII acknowledges that it bears full responsibility for addressing any such claims or lawsuits should they arise in the future.

original: a.  BII agrees that if a third party threatens or asserts any claim or files any lawsuit, claiming that BII Intellectual Property utilized under this Agreement and necessary for manufacture and production of the Product in accordance with this Agreement, including, without limitation, the BII Technology or the Process, or the use thereof, constitutes infringement of any intellectual property owned by a third party (each, a “Claim”), BII will promptly and timely inform XENCOR of such Claim, and BII shall have the first right to negotiate, litigate and/or settle any such Claim, and shall defend any such Claim unless it would not be commercially reasonable for BII to bear the reasonably anticipated losses, damages, costs and expenses arising from any settlement or judgment resulting from such Claim. For the avoidance of doubt, the term “commercially reasonable”, as used in this paragraph a. shall be determined (i) in the context of BII’s entire business related to the intellectual property that is the subject to the Claim, where the Claim asserts infringement that impacts aspects of BII’s business beyond the XENCOR relationship, and (ii) if the Claim asserts infringement that is limited only to activities performed for XENCOR, in the context of the entire relationship between XENCOR and BII.
ollama_generated: a. Under this Agreement, XENCOR acknowledges that in the event a third party alleges any claim or initiates litigation, asserting that the intellectual property utilized by BII for manufacturing and producing the Product, specifically encompassing the BII Technology or the Process, or their use thereof, infringes on intellectual property owned by said third party (each, a "Claim"), BII shall immediately notify XENCOR of such Claim. However, BII retains the sole discretion to negotiate, litigate, and/or settle any such Claim, although BII is not obligated to defend any such Claim if it would be unreasonable for BII, under the circumstances and considering its entire business related to the intellectual property at issue, particularly when the Claim extends beyond the scope of the relationship between XENCOR and BII, to bear the potential losses, damages, costs, and expenses that may result from any settlement or judgment stemming from such Claim. The term "unreasonable," as used in this clause, shall be determined based on a consideration of BII's entire business related to the intellectual property that is the subject of the Claim, taking into account the potential impact on BII's business beyond the XENCOR relationship, and if the Claim pertains solely to activities performed for XENCOR, in light of the overall relationship between XENCOR and BII.

original: b.  XENCOR’s Indemnification Obligations Always subject to Section 7.4, XENCOR shall indemnify, defend and hold BII and its Representatives harmless from and against all Losses incurred by them as a result of third party claims based on or resulting from (i) BII’s use of the XENCOR Confidential Information and Know-How, the Material, the XENCOR Intellectual Property and/or the XENCOR Technology in accordance with this Agreement; or (ii) XENCOR’s non­compliance with the warranties given under Sections 6.1 and 6.2 of this Agreement, or (iii) XENCOR’s use of the Deliverables (including but not limited to the Product, if any), or (iv) XENCOR’ s use of the Process, the BII Technology, the BII Confidential Information and Know-How, and/or any other results of the Project or this Agreement, not in accordance with this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
a. In compliance with Section 7.4, BII shall have the right to seek indemnification from XENCOR for any losses sustained by them arising from third-party claims pertaining to: (i) BII's utilization of the XENCOR Confidential Information and Know-How, the Material, the XENCOR Intellectual Property, and/or the XENCOR Technology, as permitted by this Agreement; or (ii) any breaches of the warranties provided under Sections 6.1 and 6.2 by XENCOR, or (iii) BII's use of the Deliverables (including, but not limited to, the Product, if applicable), or (iv) BII's use of the Process, the XENCOR Technology, the XENCOR Confidential Information and Know-How, and/or any other outcomes stemming from the Project or this Agreement, when such usage contradicts the terms of this Agreement.

This modification shifts the indemnification obligation from XENCOR to BII, allowing the latter to seek reimbursement for certain losses under specified circumstances.

original: 8 Intellectual Property 8.1  Existing Intellectual Property Rights BII hereby acknowledges that XENCOR is the owner of XENCOR Confidential Information and Know-How and the XENCOR Technology and BII shall acquire no rights, title or interest whatsoever in or to any of XENCOR Confidential Information and Know-How and/or XENCOR Technology, except as specifically provided for in this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
8 Intellectual Property
8.1  Ownership of Existing Intellectual Property Rights
In this Agreement, BII acknowledges that XENCor is the sole owner of XENCor's Confidential Information, Know-How, and Technology (hereinafter "XENCor IP"). Furthermore, it is expressly stated that upon the execution of this Agreement, BII shall not acquire any rights, title, or interest in or to any portion of the XENCor IP, except as may be explicitly granted under the terms of this Agreement. However, BII shall have a non-exclusive, limited license to use the XENCor IP solely for the purpose of performing its obligations and exercising its rights under this Agreement.

original: For the avoidance of doubt, (i) know-how pertaining to manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals generally and gained during the course of performing this Agreement may be freely used by BII in its biopharmaceutical business without any restrictions, provided, that, notwithstanding the foregoing, BII may not use any Other Improvement that relates specifically to the Product.

original: BII shall mitigate all wind-down costs and non-cancellable expenses to the extent possible. Campaigns cancelled shall be paid as provided for in Section 4.2 above. The use of the Process is subject to Sections 5.2.3, 5.2.4 and 5.2.5.
ollama_generated: BII is only required to reduce wind-down costs and non-cancellable expenses to a reasonable extent. In cases where campaigns are terminated, compensation will be determined in accordance with Section 4.2 above. For the sake of clarity, it should be noted that if termination occurs as described in this Section 10.3.2b, BII retains the right to continue adhering to Section 3.1.2.c. The utilization of the Process is subject to Sections 5.2.3, 5.2.4, and 5.2.5; however, BII shall not be held liable for any unforeseen circumstances arising from their application.

original: 11.3  Secrecy Agreement between the Parties The Parties agree that all information exchanged pursuant to the Secrecy Agreement between the Parties with effectiveness as of June 28, 2011 shall be Confidential Information and Know-How protected in accordance with this Agreement, and such Secrecy Agreement shall be superseded by the terms of this Agreement and shall have no further force or effect.
ollama_generated: 11.3 Confidentiality Obligations between the Parties: The Parties acknowledge their mutual obligations to preserve the confidentiality of any information shared prior to this Agreement, effective from June 28, 2011, which shall be deemed as Confidential Information and Know-How. It is understood that these prior confidentiality arrangements may continue to apply concurrently with the terms of this Agreement, unless specifically superseded or amended by mutual agreement in writing. This does not imply a diminishment or waiving of the Parties' ongoing obligations under any existing confidentiality agreements, but rather serves to supplement them where there may be overlap or conflict.

original: 11.4  Publicity XENCOR or BII may issue the mutually agreed press release attached as Appendix 8  announcing the execution of this Agreement. Except as provided in the preceding sentence, no press release or other form of publicity regarding a Project or this Agreement shall be permitted by either Party to be published unless both Parties have indicated their consent to the form of the release in writing. The same applies, to any changes in the press release attached as Appendix 8. Nothing in this Section shall prevent the Parties from disclosing this Agreement, if and as far as required by applicable laws, rules or regulations. However, the disclosing Party shall inform the other Party well in advance whenever reasonably possible and shall provide the opportunity to comment on such required disclosure (e.g. under SEC rules). In addition, subject to XENCOR’s compliance with Section 9.1, nothing in this Section shall prevent XENCOR from disclosing the status of development, regulatory approval or commercialization of the Product.
modified: 11.4  Either Party, XENCOR or BII, retains the right to issue a mutually agreed press release as outlined in Appendix 8, announcing the execution of this Agreement without prior written consent from the other Party. Any additional press releases or publicity concerning a Project or this Agreement, and any subsequent alterations to the attached press release (Appendix 8), require the explicit written approval of both Parties before publication. Notwithstanding this Section, either Party may disclose this Agreement when legally mandated, provided they inform the other Party in a timely manner whenever feasible and offer an opportunity for comment on such disclosure, as with SEC rules. Furthermore, subject to XENCOR's compliance with Section 9.1, XENCOR is free to publicly disclose the status of development, regulatory approval, or commercialization of the Product without prior written consent from BII.

original: 11.5  Notices Any notice required or permitted to be given hereunder by either Party shall be in writing and shall be (i) delivered personally, (ii) sent by registered mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid or (iii) delivered by facsimile with immediate confirmation of receipt, to the addresses or facsimile numbers set forth below:
ollama_generated:
11.5 Notifications: Any notification needed or permitted under this Agreement shall be made in writing and may be (i) hand-delivered, (ii) sent via email with read receipt confirmation or (iii) delivered by courier service with proof of delivery, to the contact details provided below:

This revision allows for notifications via email, which is a more common and potentially quicker method of communication in today's digital age. The original clause only allowed for registered mail, facsimile, and personal delivery.

original: 11.7  Entire Agreement This Agreement (including the Exhibits and Schedules attached hereto) constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties relating to its subject matter and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous agreements, understandings or representations, either written or oral, between XENCOR and BII with respect to such subject matter (including the Secrecy Agreement effective as of June 28, 2011).
modified: 11.7 Scope of Agreement: Any and all communications, representations, or understandings, whether written or oral, previously made between XENCOR and BII regarding the subject matter of this Agreement (including the Exhibits, Schedules, and the Secrecy Agreement effective as of June 28, 2011) are hereby acknowledged by both Parties. However, it is understood that any agreements, understandings, or representations outside of this written Agreement shall not supersede or amend its terms unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties and added as an amendment to this Agreement.

original: 11.10  Dispute Resolution Any dispute relating to the Project shall first be submitted for resolution to the Steering Committee.
ollama_generated: 11.10 Dispute Resolution: In the event of any disagreement concerning the Project, parties are initially encouraged to engage in informal discussions with the Steering Committee to seek a mutually agreeable solution; failing which, either party retains the right to pursue independent resolution mechanisms outside of the Steering Committee's jurisdiction.

original: 11.12  Independent Contractors Nothing in this Agreement is intended, or shall be deemed, to establish a joint venture or partnership (or any fiduciary duty) between XENCOR and BII. Neither Party to this Agreement shall have any express or implied right or authority to assume or create any obligations on behalf of, or in the name of, the other Party, or to bind the other Party to any contract, agreement or undertaking with any third party.
ollama_generated: 11.12 Independently Acting Entities: It is explicitly understood that this Agreement does not imply, nor should it be interpreted as creating, a joint venture, partnership, or any mutual obligations beyond those expressly stated, including the establishment of fiduciary duties between XENCOR and BII. Each Party maintains the exclusive authority to undertake and commit actions only in their own name, without incurring obligations or responsibilities on behalf of, or binding the other Party, to any third party contract, agreement, or undertaking, unless specifically authorized in writing.

In the event that either party fails to perform its obligations under this Agreement in a timely manner, the other party shall have the right, but not the obligation, to terminate this Agreement with immediate effect, without prejudice to any other rights or remedies it may have. ollama_generated:
Obligation Regarding Confidentiality and Proprietary Information of the Project Team and Steering Committee (as defined herein):

All members of the aforementioned committees agree, during their tenure and thereafter, to maintain the confidentiality of any and all non-public information received in connection with this Agreement. Specifically excluded from this obligation are any materials, data, or information that (i) were publicly available at the time of disclosure, (ii) become publicly available after disclosure through no fault of the recipient, or (iii) are lawfully obtained from a third party who has the right to disclose such information.

In the event that any member is required by law or governmental regulation to disclose any of the confidential or proprietary information, they shall provide prior written notice to the other party and cooperate in seeking an protective order or other appropriate remedy to preserve the confidentiality of such information to the extent possible under applicable law.

It is expressly understood that a breach of this obligation may result in significant harm to the disclosing party, and as such, any member who violates this provision shall be liable for any damages arising from such violation, including but not limited to reasonable attorney's fees and costs associated with enforcing this provision.

[Confidential Treatment Requested: Appendix 4]

original: Heidi Chokeir, Ph.D.
ollama_generated:
Shall be hereinafter referred to as the "Consultant": Heidi Chokeir, Ph.D.

The Consultant shall not bear any liability for the outcome or results of the advice, recommendations, or suggestions provided in this agreement, unless such liability arises from gross negligence or willful misconduct on their part. The Consultant's responsibilities are limited to offering professional guidance based on their expertise, and they shall not be held accountable for any unintended consequences or unforeseen events that may arise as a result of the implementation of such advice.

In the event that the parties involved in this agreement disagree with the Consultant's advice or recommendations, it is incumbent upon them to seek additional opinions from other qualified professionals before taking any actions based on the Consultant's input. The Consultant's role is advisory and consultative only, and they shall not be considered as a party responsible for the execution of any decisions made by the parties in this agreement.

In the unlikely event that legal action is required, the Consultant shall have the right to retain their own counsel at their expense, and the parties agree to indemnify and hold harmless the Consultant from any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, or expenses arising out of this agreement or the services provided under it.

This clause is intended to clarify the nature of the relationship between the parties and the Consultant, and it does not limit the applicability of other provisions in this agreement that may pertain to the Consultant's obligations, rights, or responsibilities.
